channel.title: Run.bat Error? Please Help
channel.description:
When I open my run.bat I have this error, and I got no Idea how to fix it. I would love it if someone could assist me into fixing it. Thank you so much. ;D
[code] [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1 [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: at server.model.items.ItemAssistant.bankItem(ItemAssista nt.java:1912) [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: at server.model.players.packets.ClickingButtons.processB utton(ClickingButtons.java:199) [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: at server.model.players.packets.ClickingButtons.processP acket(ClickingButtons.java:20) [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: at server.model.players.PacketHandler.processPacket(Pack etHandler.java:139) [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: at server.model.players.Client.processQueuedPackets(Clie nt.java:1120) [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: at server.model.players.PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHand ler.java:136) [18/04/13 2:02 PM]: at server.Server.main(Server.java:139)[/code]

item.title: Run.bat Error? Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Joseph69 Joseph69
item.description:
@Joseph69 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:6, topic:517016”]Looking at it, theirs no issue with that code. Hmm.

You know in the OP you quoted your error? Go into the java files stated and look at the lines of code, (the number after is the line). If you see a large number in those lines quote the method here.[/quote]it’s really weird man, now my run.bat is giving me this error.

item.title: Run.bat Error? Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Joseph69 Joseph69
item.description:
@Joseph69 wrote:

Here you go

public boolean bankItem(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) { if (c.inTrade) return false; if (c.playerItemsN[fromSlot] <= 0){ return false; } if (!Item.itemIsNote[c.playerItems[fromSlot]-1]) { if (c.playerItems[fromSlot] <= 0) { return false; } if (Item.itemStackable[c.playerItems[fromSlot]-1] || c.playerItemsN[fromSlot] > 1) { int toBankSlot = 0; boolean alreadyInBank=false; for (int i=0; i< Config.BANK_SIZE; i++) { if (c.bankItems[i] == c.playerItems[fromSlot]) {

item.title: Run.bat Error? Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Since it’s rsps I’m going to say the ID number trying to be accessed is bigger than the size of the array.

I.e. your array can only hold lets say 10 values and your trying to access an 11th value which does not exist meaning it will result in this error.
I can tell this post makes like no sense (I’m pretty tired) so I’m just going to recommend you google “java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException” and I’m sure one of the first pages that come up will provide a solution you understand.

Read full topic
